subhead: Since summer 2024, radical British groups have periodically traveled to the French shores of the English Channel, aiming to 'stop the boats' and protest what they describe as a migrant invasion.

For this pilot's widow, Sarkozy's Libyan funding case is personal
subhead: The 1989 bombing of UTA Flight 772, ordered by the Libyan regime of Muammar Gaddafi, robbed Maryvone Raveneau of her husband. As a plaintiff in the trial of Nicolas Sarkozy, who is accused of having struck a deal with Gaddafi, she has been disappointed by the media battle waged by the former French president and his supporters.

title: 'The Voice of Hind Rajab' is more than a film about a child killed in Gaza
subhead: Kaouther Ben Hania's unprecedented work is less a film about Gaza and Hind Rajab, who was killed by Israeli tanks, than it is about our individual and collective powerlessness to stop the horror of mass killings, writes columnist Jean-Pierre Filiu.

title: Steve Cropper, soul music's unsung hero, has died
subhead: A member of the Blues Brothers, the American musician and producer left his mark on classics such as Wilson Pickett's 'In the Midnight Hour' and Otis Redding's '(Sittin' on) The Dock of the Bay.' He died on December 3 at the age of 84.

title: 'Notre-Dame de Paris's triumph highlights the Church's uncharitable position in refusing to charge tourists'
subhead: Not charging the millions of visitors who flock to the Paris cathedral each year is incomprehensible when considering the dire state of public finances devoted to the conservation of France's religious heritage, writes Le Monde's Michel Guerrin in his column.

title: 'With 'The American Revolution' series, director Ken Burns warns against the tendency to judge heroes of the past through the eyes of the present'
subhead: In a spectacular documentary, the filmmaker advocates for a nuanced and diverse understanding of the history of the American War of Independence against the British Crown – a perspective that does not sit well with all Republicans, explains Le Monde's Corine Lesnes.
